forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain after 2am. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 47. West wind around 18 mph, with gusts as high as 23 mph. Chance of precipitation is 80%. New rainfall amounts between a quarter and half of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Tuesday
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain before 7am, then showers and thunderstorms. Cloudy. High near 52, with temperatures falling to around 49 in the afternoon. West southwest wind 18 to 28 mph, with gusts as high as 35 mph. Chance of precipitation is 100%. New rainfall amounts between a half and three quarters of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As dawn silently breaks over the city, a thick veil of clouds stretches over Downtown San Francisco, carrying the promise of a night drenched in rain. The air feels crisp, almost edgy, brushing against the skin. With a temperature lingering in the chill of the early forties, the wind, a playful yet formidable presence, sweeps down from the West at a brisk pace, setting the stage for an unsettled day ahead. The forecast speaks of rain beginning in the early hours and carrying through, with the possibility of thunderstorms adding a dramatic flair to an otherwise routine Tuesday. 

Expect the heavens to open wide, drenching the city with substantial rainfall; local puddles may emerge where sunlight rarely ventures. The atmosphere is laden with the scent of wet earth and ocean mist, yet one might still yearn for adventure amid the overcast. It is best to dress in layers to combat the chill, opting for waterproof attire coupled with sturdy shoes—perfect for navigating the slick streets that will soon teem with droplets. As the storm brews, consider seeking refuge in one of the cozy corners of a downtown café, perhaps curled up with a good book as the world outside dances beneath the rain's relentless rhythm. Alternatively, an impromptu visit to a local museum may prove gratifying, sheltering you from the elements while feeding your curiosity.
